humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, 4 out of the 10 examined lymph nodes were positive for metastases (Axillary 4/10). Based on the new rules provided, N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage for this patient's cancer is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that 4 out of the 10 examined lymph nodes demonstrated metastases (Axillary 4/10). This corresponds to an N1 stage, as defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC). The N stage is based on the number of lymph nodes involved, and in this case, N1 corresponds to metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. The report does not mention extracapsular invasion, which is not required for determining the N stage. The substaging information is not provided, so we should ignore it for this question.
